title: England 39-10 Argentina REPORT: Six tries book England's path to the quarter finals
text:
England qualified for the knockout roads of the World Cup with a game to spare as they outmanned Argentina in Tokyo.

A Jonny May try had given the Red Rose a slender lead when Argentina had Tomas Lavanini sent off for a dangerously high tackle on Owen Farrell.

That proved to be decisive, as England immediately made their advantage count, with Elliot Daly and Ben Youngs both scoring before half-time.

Daly used May on the outside as a decoy before squeezing between two men and darting for the line.

Youngs then capitalised on good work from Billy Vunipola to score and put England in a commanding position.

(Image: Getty Images)

George Ford soon added a fourth try after the break, as England spread the play across the field before feeding the fly-half to score.

Farrell had struggled to find his kicking boots, missing all of his first four attempts, but finally pulled it together to convert a penalty.

Argentina did hit back through a well worked Matias Moroni try, but it was little more than a consolation.

(Image: Getty Images)

England restored their advantage through Jack Nowell's effort, who having only just come on as a sub bounced off the Argentinian defence before breaking away to dive for the line.

They then sealed their victory at the death as Luke Cowan-Dickie continued his rich form in the tournament with another try.
description: A first half red card for Argentina's Tomas Lavanini swung the tie in England's favour as they sealed qualification
